result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. MILLER was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Trespass to Dwelling, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.14.
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
$30.00 to Joseph Rank.  
$353.00 to Pawn America.
All restitution is joint and several with Justin Anderson.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Maintain full-time employment, schooling or work search.

Pay supervision fees in an amount to be determined by the Department of Corrections.

Submit to random urine screens and pay for same.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Submit a DNA sample and pay surcharge.

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the Department's assessment process.

Have no contact with the co-defendant, Justin Anderson.

Have no contact with Cody Piontek and Joseph Rank or their residences and have no contact with Pawn America.
AODA assessment and follow through counseling.

Request and Response Re: Copies for Ozaukee County DA. Mailed on 02-02-2017
Plea date set for 11-22-2016 at 1:45 p.m., Br. 2.
Status conference on October 4, 2016 at 08:45 am.

Defendant waives his right to a preliminary hearing.   Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for further proceedings.    
ARRAIGNMENT 
Information filed.   Not guilty pleas.   Jury Calendar.    Settlement conference with the District Attorney is set for 06-16-16 at 10:30 a.m.    Bail is set at $2,000.00 recognizance bond with the conditions that defendant must report to the Manitowoc County Sheriff's Department for fingerprints, photographs and other identifying information within 24 hours or as soon as he returns to the State of Wisconsin and defendant is to have no contact with Mr. and Mrs. Joseph and Heather Rank or their residence in Mishicot.   Bail furnished.
